info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:30PM EDT until June 16 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR MERCER COUNTY... At 329 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Kinsman, or 15 miles north of Sharpsville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Hermitage, Sharon, Grove City, Sharpsville, Greenville, Mercer, Stoneboro, Sandy Lake, Clark, Jamestown, Fredonia, and Jackson Center. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
